title: Firefox Sidebar API Limitations
details:
Firefox only allows ONE sidebar_action per extension in manifest.json. This is a fundamental architectural limitation, not a configuration issue.

**Constraints:**
- Cannot declare multiple sidebar_action entries
- sidebar_action.setPanel() can change content but not create multiple sidebar entries
- Only one sidebar entry appears per extension in Firefox's sidebar menu
- Chrome's sidePanel API is different and supports multiple panels

**Workarounds Considered:**
- Method 1 (Multiple Separate Sidebars): NOT POSSIBLE - Firefox API limitation
- Method 2 (Two-Layer Tab System): FULLY POSSIBLE - Implemented solution
- Alternative: userChrome.js (NOT RECOMMENDED - requires Firefox customization, breaks updates)

**Why Two-Layer Tabs Work:**
- Respects single sidebar_action limitation
- Achieves logical separation at UI level
- All content within one sidebar panel
- Keyboard shortcut provides direct access to Manager
- Clear visual hierarchy prevents confusion

**References:**
- MDN: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Add-ons/WebExtensions/user_interface/Sidebars
- Implementation Guide: docs/manual/v1.6.0/dual-sidebar-implementation-guide.md
